legal_basis: sections 33 and 76 to 85 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA)
charter_rights: Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
rule_regulation: IRPA allows for the detention and potential removal of permanent residents deemed a danger to national security
decision_reasoning: balance national security interests with individual rights through an independent judicial review process
cause_of_action: constitutional challenge against certain IRPA provisions
procedure_followed: designated judge reviewed the reasonableness of the certificate and detention, considering protected information while ensuring the individual was reasonably informed
result_of_case: application dismissed; court upheld the constitutionality of the challenged IRPA provisions
